Minor.name: Minor Vandalism
Minor.tooltip: To damage, destroy, or permanently deface non-critical furniture, vendors, or personal property.

Minor.name: Assault
Minor.tooltip: To use physical force against someone without the apparent intent to kill them.

Minor.name: Disturbing the Peace
Minor.tooltip: To knowingly organize a movement which disrupts the normal operations of a department.

Minor.name: Dereliction of Duty
Minor.tooltip: To willfully abandon an obligation that is critical to the vessel's continued operation.

Minor.name: Breaking and Entering
Minor.tooltip: Forced entry to areas where the subject does not have access to. This counts for general areas only.

Minor.name: Encouragement of sympathizing Attitudes
Minor.tooltip: To openly express viewpoints or opinions sympathetic to the cause of an enemy organisation, in the attempt to encourage such thoughts among the wider crew.

Minor.name: Trespass
Minor.tooltip: To be in an area which a person has either not purposefully been admitted to, does not have access, or has been asked to leave by someone who has access to that area.

Minor.name: Workplace Negligence
Minor.tooltip: To be negligent in one's duty to an extent that it may cause harm, illness, or other negative effect, to another.

Minor.name: Petty Theft
Minor.tooltip: To steal items from another's person.

Minor.name: Possession, Illicit Substances
Minor.tooltip: The possession of illegal drugs in quantities appropriate for personal use.

Minor.name: Misrepresentation of Authorization
Minor.tooltip: To intentionally lie or mislead others that one has orders to access restricted company resources. To deceive others to gain property or credits from other personnel.

Minor.name: Indecent Exposure
Minor.tooltip: To be intentionally and publicly unclothed.

Misdemeanour.name: Vandalism, Major
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To destroy or damage non-critical furniture, vendors, or personal property in a manor that can not be repaired.

Misdemeanour.name: Assault of an Officer
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To use physical force against a Department Head or member of Security without the apparent intent to kill them.

Misdemeanour.name: Vigilantism
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To perform the responsibilities and duties of military police without approval or due cause to act.

Misdemeanour.name: Insubordination
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To knowingly disobey a lawful order from a superior.

Misdemeanour.name: Breaking and Entering, Inherently Dangerous Areas
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To trespass into an area which may lead to the injury of self or others using forcible entry.

Misdemeanour.name: Propaganda
Misdemeanour.tooltip: Advocating for defection of the ship to a hostile faction.

Misdemeanour.name: Trespass, Inherently Dangerous Areas
Misdemeanour.tooltip: Trespassing in an area which may lead to the injury of self, or others.

Misdemeanour.name: Gross Incompetence
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To be negligent in one's duty to an extent that it may cause harm to multiple individuals, a department, or in a manor which directly leads to a serious injury of another person which requires emergency medical treatment.

Misdemeanour.name: Theft
Misdemeanour.tooltip: To steal equipment or items from a workplace, or items of extraordinary value from one's person.

Misdemeanour.name: Distrubution, Illicit Substances
Misdemeanour.tooltip: The possession of dangerous or illegal drugs/equipment in a quantity greater than that which is reasonable for personal consumption.

Misdemeanour.name: Identity Fraud
Misdemeanour.tooltip: The manufacture of falsified documents or tampering with other signifiers for the purposes of; falsifying an Identity, Wearing the uniform of another department without authorization, or claiming to be reassigned to a department or command.

Major.name: Sabotage
Major.tooltip: To destroy vessel assets or resources critical to normal or emergency vessel procedures, or cause sections of the vessel to become uninhabitable.

Major.name: Aggravated Assault/Attempted Murder
Major.tooltip: To take physical action against a person with intent to grievously harm or kill.

Major.name: Rioting
Major.tooltip: To partake in an unauthorised and disruptive assembly of crewmen that refuse to disperse.

Major.name: Interference With Department Leadership
Major.tooltip: To significantly disrupt the Head of a department's ability to lead or coordinate.

Major.name: Breaking and Entering, High Security Areas
Major.tooltip: To commit trespassing into a secure area such as: Command areas, Personal offices, Weapons storage, weapon production, explosive storage, explosive production, or other high security areas, using forcible entry.

Major.name: Enemy Sympathizer
Major.tooltip: To openly call for action to the benefit of an enemy organisation, in the attempt to weaken the position of the ship, or strengthen the position of the enemy.

Major.name: Trespass, High Security Areas
Major.tooltip: Trespassing in any of the following without appropriate permission or access: Command areas, Personal offices, Weapons storage, weapon production, explosive storage, explosive production, or other high security areas.

Major.name: Manslaughter
Major.tooltip: To unintentionally kill someone through negligent, but not malicious, actions.

Major.name: Larceny
Major.tooltip: To steal rare, expensive (Items of greater than 1000 credit value), or restricted equipment from secure areas or one's person.

Major.name: Production, Illicit Substances
Major.tooltip: To produce substances such as drugs, poisons, performance enhancers, etc without explicit written permission by the Chief Medical Officer and Captain.

Major.name: Impersonation of Central Command
Major.tooltip: Falsify orders from or to impersonate a member of Central Command.

Capital.name: Grand Sabotage
Capital.tooltip: To destroy or modify vessel assets or equipment without which the vessel may collapse or otherwise become uninhabitable.

Capital.name: Inciting a Riot
Capital.tooltip: To attempt to stir the crew into a riot with the intention of disrupting the functioning of the vessel.

Capital.name: Mutiny
Capital.tooltip: To act individually, or as a group, to overthrow or subvert the established Chain of Command without lawful and legitimate cause.

Capital.name: Enemy of the Corporation
Capital.tooltip: To be a member of any of the following organizations: The syndicate, Hostile boarding parties, Wizards, Changeling Hiveminds, cults, or other non-authorized religious practitioners (heretics).

Capital.name: Grand Larceny
Capital.tooltip: To steal inherently dangerous items from their storage, one's person, or other such methods acquire through illicit means.
